"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556a9cd46368722406681000#post_556a9cd46368722406681000
[bq="EHAN"]Lucky Star ep20 impressions

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[spoiler]flies. yeah i can relate to this too. at least now we have a bug zapper for them, so now we only find maybe one or two in our house nowadays, we were pretty much infested a week ago XD 

Konata thinking about food over skill 

"wow! i could never ever smack a mosquito!" "why?" my thoughts exactly Konata 

"and if you flex your arm harder, the mosquito explodes" "NO STOP IT DON'T DO IT" my thoughts exactly Yutaka 

"YOU KEEP COMING IN WHEN I'M TAKING A BREAK" Konata. Stop being me. 

wait why did i still have to do research papers in high school but they dont >_> 

seriously, how do people actually take naps unless they have like heat stroke or something 

FIREWORKS 

they never announce anything at my fireworks shows...? 

mosquito bites everywhere 

who is this with Akira 

welp i guess it doesn't matter much because the segment decided to end 

more weird EDs[/spoiler]

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

four episodes left? the end of the series really snuck up on me[/bq]
page break

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556a97ad63687204e9ff0a00#post_556a97ad63687204e9ff0a00
I guess in the end, Pokemon prevails as a franchise consumer wise.

I remember in my childhood the bitter rivalry between the two franchises. 

Also, what the frick happened to Neopets? They were like the most popular thing on the internet from 1999 to 2003. Neopets looked promising to be a primary competition to the Pokemon franchise. But now, no body talks or even remembers the franchise. Not even Furries.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556a9ee163687204e9aa1800#post_556a9ee163687204e9aa1800

I know; it used to a great place. Problem is, Viacom neutered it down to a criminal level. Every inch of the site became heavily policed (it was impossible to talk on the forums without having your account frozen by the computer automated modding system every once in a while), older sections of the world were shut down despite complaints, and the site eventually became a dumping ground for Nick ads. What Viacom had failed to realize is that Neopets was popular with older students and college kids; they tried advertising to a completely new crowd, which drove many of its original fans away.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442
